snippet: It grew faster than the economy in 2014, the government said, as major provisions of the Affordable Care Act took effect.
abstract: Health and Human Services Dept reports health care spending in United States has risen to more than $3 trillion, due in part to expansion of Medicaid and private health insurance coverage under Affordable Care Act, along with continued sharp increase in cost of prescription drugs.
lead_paragraph: It grew faster than the economy in 2014, the government said, as major provisions of the Affordable Care Act took effect.

headline.main: Health Spending in U.S. Topped $3 Trillion Last Year
headline.print_headline: Health Spending in U.S. Topped $3 Trillion Last Year

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
